nodes.bodyText: does this assume all the clusters use the same port?
seems like this cannot be run in parallel with the previous test - we don't anyway, so just a note
too magical, just write a simple if statement and assign the value (1 or 3) instead of this calculation. think of the person who will come and read this after you and wonder why you did this.
why not just get the value you need in the for loop, so you don't need this extra call?
do you need a wait in here?
Yes, we should add some wait time here. How long should we wait here? Maybe the operator usual response time for a domain? Any ideas?
if the operator is gone, then maybe just 10-15 seconds is ok i think -- @rjeberhard ?
curious - did you change this to satisfy checkstyle rules?

nodes.bodyText: you assume all of the clusters have the same listen port
and you are not really checking it was created, you are checking it exists, which is not exactly the same thing
pods do not exist in domains
services do not exist in domain namespaces
you are not checking it was deleted, you are just checking it does not exist
you really should be checking the registry name matches the dockerImage arg
the namespace in which the domain exists
include more detail, like you do in the as()
